verses.verse: Prayer for Cleansing and Pardon To the leader. A Psalm of David, when the prophet Nathan came to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba. (Ps 4.1; 106.45; Acts 3.19) Have mercy on me, O God, according to your steadfast love; according to your abundant mercy, blot out my transgressions.
(Heb 9.14; 1 Jn 1.7) Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
(Isa 59.12) For I know my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me.
(Gen 20.6; Rom 3.4) Against you, you alone, have I sinned and done what is evil in your sight, so that you are justified in your sentence and blameless when you pass judgment.
(Job 14.4; Ps 58.3) Indeed, I was born guilty, a sinner when my mother conceived me.
(Ps 15.2; Prov 2.6) You desire truth in the inward being; (Meaning of Heb uncertain) therefore teach me wisdom in my secret heart.
(Lev 14.4; Isa 1.18) Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
(Ps 35.10) Let me hear joy and gladness; let the bones that you have crushed rejoice.
(Jer 16.17) Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.
(Ps 78.37; Acts 15.9) Create in me a clean heart, O God, and put a new and right (Or steadfast) spirit within me.
(2 Kings 13.23; Eph 4.30) Do not cast me away from your presence, and do not take your holy spirit from me.
(Ps 13.5; 2 Cor 3.17) Restore to me the joy of your salvation, and sustain in me a willing (Or generous) spirit.
(Ps 22.27; Acts 9.21, 22) Then I will teach transgressors your ways, and sinners will return to you.
(2 Sam 12.9; Ps 25.5; 35.28) Deliver me from bloodshed, O God, O God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing aloud of your deliverance.
(Ps 9.14) O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare your praise.
(1 Sam 15.22; Ps 40.6) For you have no delight in sacrifice; if I were to give a burnt offering, you would not be pleased.
(Ps 34.18) The sacrifice acceptable to God (Or My sacrifice, O God,) is a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
(Ps 102.16; Isa 51.3) Do good to Zion in your good pleasure; rebuild the walls of Jerusalem;
(Ps 4.5; 66.13, 15) then you will delight in right sacrifices, in burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings; then bulls will be offered on your altar.
